cleaned_text: ISSUE NUMBER 27 Fourth Quarter 2021 Alaska Immunization Progra m Update from the Program Manager The Alaska Immunization Program is doing our part to help limit the spread of COVID - 19 by teleworking. All hotlines will be checked periodically for messages. The best way to receive assistance is to contact us by email. General questions, IQIP, Perinatal Hep B program, and vactrak@alaska.gov Self ImmAGE: selfimmage@alaska.gov Vaccine Shipments during the Holiday Season Vaccine shipments in November and December could experience delays due to: Heavier holiday workload for FedEx, UPS, and USPS Merck, McKesson, and Pfizer's limited holiday shipping schedules Weather delays IN THIS ISSUE Vaccine Shipments during the Holiday Season Pediatric COVID -19 Vaccine COVID -19 Vaccine Boosters VacTrAK Updates VacTrAK HL7 Data Update IQIP Perinatal Hepatitis B Prevention Program Maternal Child Health & Immunization Virtual Conference Resources & Training Ask Izzy Ask Izzy Monitor your inventory closely and plan your vaccine orders carefully to allow plenty of time. Do not wait until you are out or almost out of vaccine before placing an order, no matter what time of the year it is. Submit orders by November 24th for the best chance to receive a vaccine shipment in December. Orders submitted in December may not be shipped until January. If you receive a shipment from McKesson that has been in transit too long and/or contains activated temperature monitors, please contact vaccinedepot@alaska.gov . Pediatric COVID-19 Vaccine Children ages 5 - 11 are eligible to receive the two dose pediatric Pfizer COVID -19 vaccine. You can find a flyer to share with parents here and check the CDC pages for updated materials. COVID-19 Vaccine Boosters COVID -19 vaccine boosters are available. For individuals who received a Pfizer - BioNTech or Moderna COVID -19 vaccine, the following groups are eligible for a boost er shot 6 months or more after their initial series: 65 years and older Age 18+ who live in long-term care settings Age 18+ who have un derlying medical conditions Age 18+ who work or live in high -risk settings For the Johnson & Johnson COVID -19 vaccine, booster shots are recommended for those who are 18 and older and who were vaccinated two or more months ago. Eligible individuals may choose which vaccine they receive as a booster dose. Some people may have a preference for the vaccine type they originally received while others may prefer to get a different booster. CDC's recommendations now allow for this type of mix and match dosing for booster shots. VacTrAK Updates Make sure you are reporting your administered vaccinations! It is good practice to verify that your EHR and VacTrAK match! Use the report module within VacTrAK to make Dear Izzy, How can I get my staff members access to VacTrAK? ~LP Dear LS, The VacTrAK Add/Modify User form will have to be filled out and submitted to VacTrAK. For any questions, please contact VacTrAK support at 907 -269-0312 or vactrak@alaska.gov . Dear Izzy, How can my patients get a copy or replacement immunization record/CDC COVID vaccination card? ~DM Dear DM, In order for patients to receive a copy or replacement immunization record/CDC COVID -19 vaccination card, they will have to complete the Immunization Record Request form . Follow the directions on this form and the vaccination card will be mailed to them. Due to the volume of request, processing time will be longer tha n expected. Providers can also fill out the CDC COVID vaccination card for their patients as well use VacTrAK to print a copy of the patients immunization records. COVID vaccination cards can be order with the COVID 19 Order Form. sure that all of your records are being submitted. Reports that can be useful in this are the Patient Detail Report, Vaccine Administered Report, and Vaccination Totals Report. Due to frequent changes in the guidance around COVID -19 vaccinations, VacTrAK's forecaster is being updated frequently to make sure that the forecaster is utilizing the correct logic for the current recommendations. Recent changes include: Logic changes for Pfizer, Moderna, and Janssen COVID -19 vaccine booster Addition of the Pfizer COVID -19 pediatric vaccine codes Addition of non- US COVID -19 vaccine codes Please contact vactrak@alaska.gov for any questions or concerns. VacTrAK HL7 Data Update VacTrAK is moving to require the submission of race and ethnicity data via HL7, as of January 1, 2022. Please contact vactrak@alaska.gov with any questions on this change. IQIP Do the children and adolescents have all the recommended vaccinations? As part of the VFC program, Immunization Quality Improvement for Providers (IQIP) takes place on an annual basis. The purpose of the IQIP process is to promote the implementation of quality improvement strategies designed to increase protection against vaccine- preventable diseases among childhood and adolescent patients, in adherence to the ACIP- recommended routine schedule. Please reach out to the IQIP Program Nurse Consultant at 907- 269-8088 for more information. Perinatal Hepatitis B Prevention Program Great news! There is now one Perinatal Hepatitis B Prevention Program (PHBPP) reporting form. Obstetricians and other prenatal providers, delivery facilities, and pediatric providers will be able to use the same form by completing appropriate information for the mother and/or infant. Prenatal providers will be able to enter the pregnant woman's information along with the HBsAg status, the deliver y facilities will be able to enter the date of prophylaxis and infant's information, and the pediatric providers will be able to enter the infant's post -vaccination serology testing information after completion of the Hepatitis B vaccine series. Please reach out to the Nurse Consultant for the Perinatal Hepatitis B Prevention Program for more information at 907- 269-8088. Maternal Child Health & Immunization Virtual Conference Registration and other information for this conference (February 22- 24, 2022) can be found here: http://alaskamchconference.org/index.html . This website will be updated as more information becomes available. Resources & Training Pediatric Administration Training On Friday, October 29, there was a pop-up ECHO session that aimed to support Vaccine Providers in advance of the anticipated approval of the COVID -19 vaccine for ages 5- 11. This session offered demonstrations of techniques, shared what resources for providers are available, and gave COVID -19 updates. Videos, slides, and other resources shared during this ECHO will be posted in the Box shared folder . VacTrAK is offering daily training on our user interface from 12pm- 1pm. This is a great place to refresh your VacTrAK knowledge or ask questions. https://zoom.us/j/95413335230?pwd=Wnk2eUZnT3hRaHJ5ZXQrdmNoeU9ZUT09 Meeting ID: 954 1333 5230 Passcode: Y4eyac PrepMod is offering trainings on how to utilize PrepMod for COVID, flu, childhood, or blended vaccination clinics. If you are interested in utilizing PrepMod, please contact prepmod@alaska.gov for more information and to get started.
